newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: SOCCER-DUTCH BEAT DETERMINED SAN MARINO 4-0.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-DUTCH BEAT DETERMINED SAN MARINO 4-0.

text.p: The Netherlands, favourites to qualify for the World Cup from European group seven, encountered unexpected resistance from San Marino's part-timers in winning 4-0 on Saturday.
San Marino held the game scoreless up to a minute before half-time, defending in numbers, until goalkeeper Federico Gasperoni let an innocuous Patrick Kluivert shot bobble through his legs.
The Dutch were again unable to find a rhythm in the second half, drawing whistles from the large crowd in the Amsterdam Arena, until captain Frank de Boer's 58th minute goal.
A late header from Pierre van Hooijdonk and a neat chip on the stroke of full time for De Boer's second lent some respectability to the scoreline.
The win gives the Dutch a maximum 12 points from their first four games ahead of second-placed Belgium who have nine.
